item.text: When Athaliah, the mother of Ahaziah, saw that her son was dead, she was determined to destroy the entire royal line.

So <st data-num="03089" class="">Jehosheba</st>, the <st data-num="01323" class="">daughter</st> of <st data-num="04428" class="">King</st> <st data-num="03141" class="">Jehoram</st><n id="1" /> and <st data-num="0269" class="">sister</st> of <st data-num="0274" class="">Ahaziah</st>, <st data-num="03947" class="">took</st> <st data-num="0274" class="">Ahaziah’s</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> <st data-num="03101" class="">Joash</st> and <st data-num="01589" class="">stole</st> him <st data-num="01589" class="">away</st> from the <st data-num="08432" class="">rest</st> of the <st data-num="04428" class="">royal</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">descendants</st> who were to be <st data-num="04191" class="">executed</st>. She <st data-num="05414" class="">hid</st> him and his <st data-num="03243" class="">nurse</st> in the <st data-num="02315" class="">room</st> where the <st data-num="04296" class="">bed covers</st> were stored.<n id="2" /> So he was <st data-num="05641" class="">hidden</st> <st data-num="06440" class="">from</st> <st data-num="06271" class="">Athaliah</st> and <st data-num="03808" class="">escaped</st> <st data-num="04191" class="">execution</st>.<n id="3" />
He hid out with his nurse in the Lord’s temple for six years, while Athaliah was ruling over the land.

In the seventh year Jehoiada summoned the officers of the units of hundreds of the Carians and the royal bodyguard. He met with them in the Lord’s temple. He made an agreement with them and made them swear an oath of allegiance in the Lord’s temple. Then he showed them the king’s son.

He <st data-num="06680 0559">ordered</st> them, “<st data-num="02088" class="">This</st> is <st data-num="01697 0834">what</st> you must <st data-num="06213" class="">do</st>. One <st data-num="07992" class="">third</st> <st data-num="04480" class="">of</st> the unit that <st data-num="0935" class="">is on duty</st> during the <st data-num="07676" class="">Sabbath</st> will <st data-num="08104 04931">guard</st> the <st data-num="04428" class="">royal</st> <st data-num="01004" class="">palace</st>.

Another <st data-num="07992" class="">third</st> of you will be stationed at the <st data-num="03247" class="">Foundation</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="08179" class="">Gate</st>. Still another <st data-num="07992" class="">third</st> of you will be stationed at the <st data-num="08179" class="">gate</st> <st data-num="0310" class="">behind</st> the <st data-num="07323" class="">royal guard</st>.<n id="2" /> You will <st data-num="04535" class="">take turns</st> <st data-num="08104 04931">guarding</st> the <st data-num="01004" class="">palace</st>.<n id="3" />
The two units who are off duty on the Sabbath will guard the Lord’s temple and protect the king.
You must surround the king. Each of you must hold his weapon in his hand. Whoever approaches your ranks must be killed. You must accompany the king wherever he goes.”

The officers of the units of hundreds did just as Jehoiada the priest ordered. Each of them took his men, those who were on duty during the Sabbath as well as those who were off duty on the Sabbath, and reported to Jehoiada the priest.
The priest gave to the officers of the units of hundreds King David’s spears and the shields that were kept in the Lord’s temple.

The <st data-num="07323" class="">royal bodyguard</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="05975" class="">took</st> their <st data-num="05975" class="">stations</st>, <st data-num="0376" class="">each</st> holding his <st data-num="03627" class="">weapon</st> in his <st data-num="03027" class="">hand</st>. They lined up from the <st data-num="03233" class="">south</st> <st data-num="03802" class="">side</st> of the <st data-num="01004" class="">temple</st> <st data-num="05704" class="">to</st> the <st data-num="08042" class="">north</st> <st data-num="03802 01004">side</st> and stood near the <st data-num="04196" class="">altar</st> and the <st data-num="01004" class="">temple</st>, <st data-num="05921 05439">surrounding</st> the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st>.<n id="2" />

Jehoiada led out the king’s son and placed on him the crown and the royal insignia. They proclaimed him king and poured olive oil on his head. They clapped their hands and cried out, “Long live the king!”
When Athaliah heard the royal guard shout, she joined the crowd at the Lord’s temple.

Then she <st data-num="07200 02009">saw</st><n id="1" /> the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> <st data-num="05975" class="">standing</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">by</st> the <st data-num="05982" class="">pillar</st>, according to <st data-num="04941" class="">custom</st>. The <st data-num="08269" class="">officers</st> stood <st data-num="0413" class="">beside</st> the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> with their <st data-num="02689" class="">trumpets</st>, and <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> the <st data-num="05971" class="">people</st> of the <st data-num="0776" class="">land</st> were <st data-num="08056" class="">celebrating</st> and <st data-num="08628" class="">blowing</st> <st data-num="02689" class="">trumpets</st>. <st data-num="06271" class="">Athaliah</st> <st data-num="07167" class="">tore</st> her <st data-num="0899" class="">clothes</st> and <st data-num="07121" class="">screamed</st>, “<st data-num="07195" class="">Treason</st>, <st data-num="07195" class="">treason</st>!”<n id="2" />

Jehoiada the priest ordered the officers of the units of hundreds, who were in charge of the army, “Bring her outside the temple to the guards. Put to death by the sword anyone who follows her.” The priest gave this order because he had decided she should not be executed in the Lord’s temple.
They seized her and took her into the precincts of the royal palace through the horses’ entrance. There she was executed.
Jehoiada then drew up a covenant between the Lord and the king and people, stipulating that they should be loyal to the Lord.

All the people of the land went and demolished the temple of Baal. They smashed its altars and idols to bits. They killed Mattan the priest of Baal in front of the altar. Jehoiada the priest then placed guards at the Lord’s temple.

He took the officers of the units of hundreds, the Carians, the royal bodyguard, and all the people of the land, and together they led the king down from the Lord’s temple. They entered the royal palace through the Gate of the Royal Bodyguard, and the king sat down on the royal throne.
All the people of the land celebrated, for the city had rest now that they had killed Athaliah with the sword in the royal palace.
(12:1) Jehoash was seven years old when he began to reign.
